turns.speaker: GARY
turns.text: Let's go.

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: Isn't he incredible, gets along with everybody.

turns.speaker: GARY
turns.text: Okay... We're all here. Rick, what's the big announcement?

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: All right, gentlemen, I'm not gonna sugar-coat this thing. I've known you guys since grade school, so I'm gonna give it to you straight from the hip... right from the shoulder... without beating around the bush... Nothing fancy, just the plain, hard facts... tell it like it is.

turns.speaker: GARY
turns.text: Wait a minute. You been living with Debbie! Why do you want to get married?

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: Because I love her. What can I tell you?

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: Sounds swell... I'm really touched. And my getting married's not gonna change a thing between me and my pals. We're still gonna go bowling on Tuesdays, play cards on Fridays and wear women's clothes on Sunday night. I love you guys... I always will.

turns.speaker: GARY
turns.text: Let's have a toast.

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: Give the guy air. Everyone to a neutral corner.

turns.speaker: GARY
turns.text: What's going on?

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: It's true.

turns.speaker: GARY
turns.text: This place should have been wall to wall tits by now.

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: Guy paints a beautiful picture.

turns.speaker: GARY
turns.text: I'm going to see what the hell happened.

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: Looks like the only one who got screwed here was you.

turns.speaker: GARY
turns.text: Screw that.

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: Hookers beat you up?

turns.speaker: GARY
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: I didn't know you were into that.

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: Gary, how we doing, big stallion?

turns.speaker: GARY
turns.text: Rick, I really think I'm in love.

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: This is cause for celebration. She'll probably charge half price for sex from now on.

turns.speaker: RAJAH
turns.text: What can I be doing for you?

turns.speaker: GARY
turns.text: You're a pimp?

turns.speaker: RAJAH
turns.text: I'm telling you I am, Joe.

turns.speaker: GARY
turns.text: I want women.

turns.speaker: RAJAH
turns.text: That I got. Very good women. They sit on your face, anything you want.

turns.speaker: GARY
turns.text: I'll take some.

turns.speaker: RAJAH
turns.text: Big problem now. Soon they go to customers.

turns.speaker: GARY
turns.text: I need them for a bachelor party at the Park View Hotel.

turns.speaker: RAJAH
turns.text: You are being in luck. Customers in same hotel. I let you have them at cut-rate price for 45 minutes.

turns.speaker: GARY
turns.text: Sold. 45 minutes. No problem.

turns.speaker: RAJAH
turns.text: Not one minute longer or Milt will come for you.

turns.speaker: GARY
turns.text: Milt?

turns.speaker: O'NEILL
turns.text: So, Larry, how have you been?

turns.speaker: LARRY
turns.text: Just in love with everybody. It's really a beautiful planet. I love you, Rick. I love you guys. I love everybody.

turns.speaker: LARRY
turns.text: I hate her. I hate her guts, the bitch.

turns.speaker: O'NEILL
turns.text: Larry, you and your wife got problems?

turns.speaker: LARRY
turns.text: I don't want to talk about it. I love you guys. I love my friends.

turns.speaker: O'NEILL
turns.text: Is that all the coke in the place?

turns.speaker: LARRY
turns.text: That's it.

turns.speaker: O'NEILL
turns.text: Good.

turns.speaker: LARRY
turns.text: You want to share it?

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: Naw, two on a Quaalude... bad luck.

turns.speaker: LARRY
turns.text: Right.

turns.speaker: LARRY
turns.text: My marriage is the worst. All crap. A big pile of shit.

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: Maybe your marriage should lay off grains for a while.

turns.speaker: LARRY
turns.text: She hates me. It's over. You'll see, as soon as you get married, everything changes. You sure you want to go through with it, man?

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: What do you mean, it changes?

turns.speaker: LARRY
turns.text: Guys, I think I'd rather stay here.

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: C'mon, Larry. Be good for you.

turns.speaker: LARRY
turns.text: I just want to be alone.

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: All right. Now, there's milk and cookies in the refrigerator. Go to bed right after "Falcon Crest."

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: Lar... sometimes when people are mad they say things they don't mean.

turns.speaker: LARRY
turns.text: No, she hates me... I want to end everything here... now.

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: You okay?

turns.speaker: LARRY
turns.text: Yeah, I guess so.

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: Really?

turns.speaker: LARRY
turns.text: Yeah. I see you're right. C'mon, let's party.

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: What the hell are you doing?

turns.speaker: LARRY
turns.text: I'm trying to slash my wrists.

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: You're trying to kill yourself with an electric razor?

turns.speaker: LARRY
turns.text: I couldn't find any razor blades.

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: Well, this is terrific. Now you're gonna have wrists that are smooth and kissable. Just go out there. Forget about everything and laugh it up.

turns.speaker: LARRY
turns.text: Ha, ha, ha.

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: No, have fun first. Then laugh. Now, forget about marriage for a while. Go party.

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: Hi, guys. We brought back a friend.

turns.speaker: LARRY
turns.text: It's Bullwinkle.

turns.speaker: LARRY
turns.text: It's my fault. He's dead because... I left those drugs...

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: It's really not all your fault. I was talking to Mike earlier and he had a lot of problems. Personal things, you know. Made some bad investments. At least now he's peaceful...

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: Are any of those right?

turns.speaker: MANAGER
turns.text: This is the Park View Hotel. I'm the Hotel Manager. Are you looking for someone?

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: Yes, you. We're looking for our room... 1002.

turns.speaker: MANAGER
turns.text: It's on the tenth floor.

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: What do you know, they moved it. Catch you later.

turns.speaker: MANAGER
turns.text: Keep your voices down. This is a respectable establishment. We don't go for any funny business here. Just then a GUY with a Moosehead Beer hat and TWO GUYS in a moose costume pass him and enter the elevator with the boys.

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: I see what you mean... You're a beautiful guy. And you're doing a damn good job.

turns.speaker: MANAGER
turns.text: You're all under arrest. Open up!

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: Your attention, please. May I be the first to say, It's a raid!

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: Oops!

turns.speaker: MR. THOMERSON
turns.text: All right, who serves?

turns.speaker: MR. THOMERSON
turns.text: Rick, hit the ball easier, son. You don't have to kill it.

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: Can't I just maim it a little?

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: Well, I have to admit my game's a little rusty, but I love polo. It's unrelenting, a constant challenge to the senses. Really a beautiful experience.

turns.speaker: MR. THOMERSON
turns.text: Rick, I want to cut through the b.s.

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: I'd love that.

turns.speaker: MR. THOMERSON
turns.text: Good. I think you're an asshole. No, let me correct that, an immature asshole. Which is fine, except you're marrying my daughter and I'm afraid my grandchildren are going to be little assholes.

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: Mr. Thomerson, I...

turns.speaker: MR. THOMERSON
turns.text: Let me finish. Debbie's an adult. She can do what she wants. But if you want your marriage to last, you're going to have to change some things about yourself. If I may make some suggestions...

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: Feel free.

turns.speaker: MR. THOMERSON
turns.text: First, you're a slob. You have to dress for success. Second, your outlook on life...

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: Welcome, welcome, one and all.

turns.speaker: MR. THOMERSON
turns.text: Rick!

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: Oh, no!

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: The end.

turns.speaker: MR. THOMERSON
turns.text: No sob story is going to change my mind.

turns.speaker: MR. THOMERSON
turns.text: Ebbie. Ger... umph... lable...

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: Of course, sir. That explains it. Leather is a very good source of vitamin E.

turns.speaker: MRS. THOMERSON
turns.text: Er... perhaps we ought to stop now.

turns.speaker: MR. THOMERSON
turns.text: No. Let's at least finish the set.

turns.speaker: MRS. THOMERSON
turns.text: Girls, why don't we go inside for lunch.  Boys, would you mind bringing in that lemonade?

turns.speaker: MR. THOMERSON
turns.text: In a second...  And you're irresponsible. Show some initiative, try to better yourself, stop showing off, actions speak louder than words.

turns.speaker: MR. THOMERSON
turns.text: The thought of that person marrying my daughter makes me want to upchuck.

turns.speaker: MRS. THOMERSON
turns.text: You can tell a man by his friends.

turns.speaker: MRS. THOMERSON
turns.text: Ed... you're kinky!

turns.speaker: MR. THOMERSON
turns.text: The phone made me do it!

turns.speaker: MRS. THOMERSON
turns.text: You've been having strange sex...!

turns.speaker: MR. THOMERSON
turns.text: No, Brett, I...

turns.speaker: MRS. THOMERSON
turns.text: It's all right...  So have I.

turns.speaker: O'NEILL
turns.text: How are we doing? My name is O'Neill. And you are...?

turns.speaker: WOMAN
turns.text: Klupner.  Mrs. Klupner.

turns.speaker: O'NEILL
turns.text: Mrs.?

turns.speaker: WOMAN
turns.text: I'm separated.

turns.speaker: O'NEILL
turns.text: Then there is a God. Why don't we take that baby picture.

turns.speaker: O'NEILL
turns.text: I'm getting one heck of a glare off your dress there. Could you undo a few buttons?

turns.speaker: WOMAN
turns.text: Of course.

turns.speaker: O'NEILL
turns.text: Where'd she go?

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: She probably had sex scheduled for 12:30. O'Neill, let's pick up the guys for a drink... I have major news to announce.

turns.speaker: O'NEILL
turns.text: Where the hell is he?

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: Knowing Larry, he probably missed the flight.

turns.speaker: O'NEILL
turns.text: What's the matter?

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: Nothing... Let's get crazy!

turns.speaker: O'NEILL
turns.text: We'll spend an hour with "Nymphos Without Pants"...

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: Olivier's in that, right?

turns.speaker: O'NEILL
turns.text: Then it's on to the real thing.

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: Excuse me, but this is as arousing as a stroll through the Vatican.

turns.speaker: O'NEILL
turns.text: This isn't right.

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: Don't you love it when old friends stop by?

turns.speaker: O'NEILL
turns.text: Hey, I'm starved... Let's go get something to eat. We'll bring back food for everybody.

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: I'm not really hungry.

turns.speaker: O'NEILL
turns.text: C'mon. I insist.

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: What the hell is that?

turns.speaker: O'NEILL
turns.text: My gift to you.

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: Under the table!

turns.speaker: O'NEILL
turns.text: The best table in the house.

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: I think you'll enjoy this table.

turns.speaker: O'NEILL
turns.text: So long, Father.

turns.speaker: O'NEILL
turns.text: I don't get it. Why didn't you go for it just now?

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: I don't know. Maybe it's because I love Debbie or maybe it's hard for me to get off in a place that smells like egg salad. I'm not sure.

turns.speaker: O'NEILL
turns.text: Rick, I'm concerned.

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: About what?

turns.speaker: O'NEILL
turns.text: This is your bachelor party. You haven't had sex with anyone yet.

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: Get a few drinks into me, we'll dance and see what happens.

turns.speaker: O'NEILL
turns.text: I got something you can't resist. I have a friend, Tracey. She wants to meet you. She loves to please.

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: Oooooo.

turns.speaker: O'NEILL
turns.text: Right in there, pal.

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: If I'm not out in a half hour, send for the paramedics.

turns.speaker: O'NEILL
turns.text: That's the old Rick!

turns.speaker: O'NEILL
turns.text: How'd it go?

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: Put it to you this way -- you're gonna have to pry her out of the bed with a spatula, mister.

turns.speaker: O'NEILL
turns.text: I'm proud of you, lad.

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: Who was that?

turns.speaker: O'NEILL
turns.text: I don't know.

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: What's this?

turns.speaker: O'NEILL
turns.text: Got me.

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: How 'bout this?

turns.speaker: O'NEILL
turns.text: Still drawing a blank.

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: He look familiar?

turns.speaker: O'NEILL
turns.text: Very.

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: C'mon. Get the hookers in a circle. We better put Cochise out of business.

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: Now, don't get into any trouble.

turns.speaker: O'NEILL
turns.text: Take care.

turns.speaker: O'NEILL
turns.text: Hey, you guys...

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: Who's your friend?

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: How about this, a Trojan donkey.

turns.speaker: O'NEILL
turns.text: And here's Mike's partner, in more ways than one. A gal who doesn't think happiness ends with primates. The very lovely, Miss Desiree...

turns.speaker: O'NEILL
turns.text: What are you going to do about it?

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: What can I do? I'm dead. Debbie's going to go crazy and end the whole thing.

turns.speaker: O'NEILL
turns.text: I'll stop him... You stall him.

turns.speaker: O'NEILL
turns.text: Reach out and snort someone.

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: I'm saved. Let's party!

turns.speaker: O'NEILL
turns.text: Guess who's here? Another surprise guest.

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: Who?

turns.speaker: O'NEILL
turns.text: Debbie.

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: My Debbie?

turns.speaker: O'NEILL
turns.text: What's with her costume?

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: I don't know... Go up to her, make like you don't know her and send her into the other bedroom.

turns.speaker: O'NEILL
turns.text: You got it.

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: You always were sneaky, Stan, very sneaky.

turns.speaker: STAN
turns.text: Rick, marriage will be good for you. It's done wonders for me.

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: True, you're a lot handsomer now. Don't you have enough blood already?

turns.speaker: STAN
turns.text: You won't miss a thing about being single... The wild parties, the different girls every night, running around like a maniac... God, I miss that.

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: Stan, you're depressing me... Hey, I didn't know you were going to fill 'er up. Just take a couple of gallons, okay?

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: That's an even trade... a cotton ball for all my blood.

turns.speaker: STAN
turns.text: Okay, Rick, all finished. I can't wait for that bachelor party... I need the action.

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: Nah, that's okay. My brother has to look up old people's asses all day long. Let's give him a break.

turns.speaker: STAN
turns.text: Right. Give me the will to live. Let me go first.

turns.speaker: STAN
turns.text: Thanks a lot, that was the best. You're next.

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: Nah, not yet. Look, you're my older brother. I need some advice here. What's the deal with marriage? What can I expect?

turns.speaker: STAN
turns.text: Well, the first month it's great. The second month things calm down a little. By the third month you're looking through your old girlfriends' phone numbers; by the fourth month you're numb; by the fifth month, hopefully the football season starts.

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: Thanks, Stan, you've been a lot of help.

turns.speaker: STAN
turns.text: Oh... it's... er... the guys from the beer convention. We're bringing them to the party.

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: Great.  I was wondering, how do you guys go to the bathroom in that thing?

turns.speaker: SISTER MARY FRANCIS
turns.text: You're late again, Rick.

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: I know, Sister, but I have a very good excuse.

turns.speaker: SISTER MARY FRANCIS
turns.text: There can be no excuse for tardiness.

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: You're absolutely right. I should never have stopped to save that drowning infant. I'm just weak, Sister; I'm so weak.

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: Sister, do you ever get lonely after vespers? If you do, why don't you give me a call. I'm in the book.

turns.speaker: SISTER MARY FRANCIS
turns.text: Get going, Rick... you're late enough as it is.

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: Right... Think it over.

turns.speaker: STAN
turns.text: How the hell are we supposed to get this donkey inside?

turns.speaker: RYKO
turns.text: I don't know.

turns.speaker: STAN
turns.text: What? I thought you told me you had it all figured out.

turns.speaker: RYKO
turns.text: Maybe I did... I don't remember.

turns.speaker: STAN
turns.text: I'd love to get you in an operating room. Just once.

turns.speaker: RYKO
turns.text: Can you believe how perfect it fits?

turns.speaker: STAN
turns.text: Yeah. Who'd have thought they'd both be a size 138 regular.

turns.speaker: AXE
turns.text: Oh these moments do try me...

turns.speaker: STEPHEN
turns.text: Be gentle.

turns.speaker: AXE
turns.text: Wash it to the windows?

turns.speaker: STEPHEN
turns.text: No, we'll hit the son of a bitch head on.

turns.speaker: AXE
turns.text: It's gonna flash, Stevie. We gotta get behind it.

turns.speaker: STEPHEN
turns.text: Nah, listen to it. It's a pussy. It'll just steam on us. It won't flash. Go high in the ceiling.

turns.speaker: AXE
turns.text: That's Franny. She likes firemen.

turns.speaker: STEPHEN
turns.text: Tim, fill out the alarm card.  Clean the pipe poles, wipe down the ladders and hang some hose.

turns.speaker: AXE
turns.text: Goddamn it, Stephen, lay off!  You stupid dumbshit, you never know when to fucking quit, do you? You ever wonder why your career's in the fucking toilet? Why you're gonna be stuck a Lt. for life?

turns.speaker: STEPHEN
turns.text: No.  I need a drink.

turns.speaker: STEPHEN
turns.text: You know Knowlton pretty well?

turns.speaker: AXE
turns.text: Yeah...

turns.speaker: STEPHEN
turns.text: Kind of an asshole, wasn't he?

turns.speaker: AXE
turns.text: Biggest in two battalions.

turns.speaker: STEPHEN
turns.text: We're gonna be okay, man...

turns.speaker: STEPHEN
turns.text: Adcox, go with Pengelly and check the other side.

turns.speaker: AXE
turns.text: It isn't safe, man. Don't go splittin' us up. Not with this one.

turns.speaker: STEPHEN
turns.text: -- What the hell's the matter with you? You always check the other side. I haven't got time for bullshit right now, okay? We got a job here.

turns.speaker: AXE
turns.text: Let me take the lead, Stephen...

turns.speaker: STEPHEN
turns.text: Goddamn it Adcox! Just do your fucking job!

turns.speaker: AXE
turns.text: Aw man, Stephen, listen to me...

turns.speaker: STEPHEN
turns.text: -- What the fuck were you thinking, huh? Burning people? You're a fireman.

turns.speaker: AXE
turns.text: They were killing firemen, man. When Sally showed me what was in Swayzak's files... They were my friends, I had to do it. I had to do it for the department.

turns.speaker: STEPHEN
turns.text: -- Knock it off!

turns.speaker: AXE
turns.text: -- You can't let him turn you against your friends, man --

turns.speaker: AXE
turns.text: ...What do you want me to do, Stephen? Talk to me. What am I supposed to do?

turns.speaker: STEPHEN
turns.text: There's a fire. We've got a job here. Let's get on with it.

turns.speaker: STEPHEN
turns.text: You stupid son of a bitch! What the fuck are you doing!

turns.speaker: AXE
turns.text: Stevie... I...

turns.speaker: AXE
turns.text: Hey, baby McCaffrey. First one's the clincher. You did okay.

turns.speaker: BRIAN
turns.text: My Lt. might have something to say about that.

turns.speaker: AXE
turns.text: Ah, everybody screws up some, Brian. You're working for the toughest Lt. on the job. Saw him once pick up a probie he thought was moving too slow and throw him into a burning building. It's just bad luck you're family.

turns.speaker: BRIAN
turns.text: John, when you're in there... in the fire... do you ever see...

turns.speaker: BRIAN
turns.text: Is he...

turns.speaker: AXE
turns.text: He's alive.

turns.speaker: BRIAN
turns.text: Did you do it for Tim?

turns.speaker: AXE
turns.text: That was an accident! Jesus Christ, why did you have to go in there so fucking early? Why didn't you listen to me!

turns.speaker: AXE
turns.text: You gotta let me finish --

turns.speaker: BRIAN
turns.text: Just come down, John. Just --

turns.speaker: AXE
turns.text: -- Shut up! Your dad would fucking puke if he saw how you've shit on his department!

turns.speaker: BRIAN
turns.text: -- He killed people --

turns.speaker: AXE
turns.text: -- You know what Swayzak would do to the department if this got out? --

turns.speaker: BRIAN
turns.text: -- Stephen, this is bullshit --

turns.speaker: AXE
turns.text: -- What he would do to your dad's department? You gotta let me finish it --

turns.speaker: STEPHEN
turns.text: It doesn't go like that.

turns.speaker: BRIAN
turns.text: Who asked you?

turns.speaker: STEPHEN
turns.text: If you do it like that it'll open in the fire. Then you'll get burned and DIE.

turns.speaker: STEPHEN
turns.text: Well, look what we have here. Nice costume. Rent it?

turns.speaker: BRIAN
turns.text: I want to thank you for coming to my graduation, Stephen. It was a great inspiration to me.

turns.speaker: STEPHEN
turns.text: So you're going to fight fires now, huh?

turns.speaker: STEPHEN
turns.text: Doesn't work on you.  See ya around, little brother.

turns.speaker: BRIAN
turns.text: Not likely.

turns.speaker: STEPHEN
turns.text: Well, see you're wrong already. Had a talk with Chief Fitzgerald, and we decided in the interest of brotherly love, that maybe you shouldn't be way over on the other side of town. So starting tomorrow, your assigned to company 17. My company.  One case of scotch, you're getting cheap in your old age, Brian...

turns.speaker: BRIAN
turns.text: I like what you've done with the place.

turns.speaker: STEPHEN
turns.text: It's comin' along... want a beer?

turns.speaker: BRIAN
turns.text: Been ripping off fire stations?

turns.speaker: STEPHEN
turns.text: It's old stuff Adcox gave me that the department was going to throw out anyway. Still good enough though for this tub.

turns.speaker: BRIAN
turns.text: My God, an actual operating 8-track.

turns.speaker: STEPHEN
turns.text: What, you've never seen one before?

turns.speaker: BRIAN
turns.text: In the Field Museum once.

turns.speaker: STEPHEN
turns.text: It works.

turns.speaker: BRIAN
turns.text: It worked when you were in sixth grade.

turns.speaker: STEPHEN
turns.text: People actually used to pay you for this?

turns.speaker: BRIAN
turns.text: Millions, Stephen -- And sexual favors.

turns.speaker: STEPHEN
turns.text: Sheep don't count.

turns.speaker: BRIAN
turns.text: Yeah? What about Laura --

turns.speaker: STEPHEN
turns.text: That was never proved.

turns.speaker: STEPHEN
turns.text: Why'd you come here, Brian?

turns.speaker: BRIAN
turns.text: I wanted to know why you messed with my station assignment. I mean, is this really gonna have to one of those big brother -- little brother "you broke my GI Joe and I'm still pissed" games?

turns.speaker: STEPHEN
turns.text: What is it with you, man, huh? How do you manage to keep coming up with new and amazing ways to screw up? That scotch bullshit? Am I really supposed to believe you came crawling back home because you suddenly felt heart strings moan for the family biz? You were bankrupt, man.

turns.speaker: BRIAN
turns.text: Hey! You don't know me --

turns.speaker: STEPHEN
turns.text: I know you cold, Brian. The scary thing is, you probably could have faked it for awhile. But you see, in this job there's no place to hide. Isn't like selling log cabins. You have a bad day here -- someone dies. And that's not fucking good enough. Want another beer?

turns.speaker: BRIAN
turns.text: So that's it? Big bad brother's gonna ride my ass till I cough blood?

turns.speaker: STEPHEN
turns.text: Big bad brother is going to treat you like any other probie -- that I don't think is going to make it.

turns.speaker: BRIAN
turns.text: There's only so much technology can do.  Thanks for the beer.

turns.speaker: STEPHEN
turns.text: Thanks for the speakers.

turns.speaker: BRIAN
turns.text: Y'know, I told myself a million times I didn't want to be a fireman. I said bullshit to that line about tradition and family legacy. I know I split, and I know how you felt...

turns.speaker: STEPHEN
turns.text: Yeah, you know. You know what it felt like.

turns.speaker: BRIAN
turns.text: I gotta do this, Stephen. I gotta know.

turns.speaker: STEPHEN
turns.text: I think you're gonna find out, Brian. Don't be late tomorrow.

turns.speaker: STEPHEN
turns.text: Ya love it, probie?

turns.speaker: BRIAN
turns.text: I'm in heaven, Lt.

turns.speaker: STEPHEN
turns.text: Hook us up to a stand-pipe.

turns.speaker: STEPHEN
turns.text: Y'know, you got an awful short memory for direct orders. I told you to stay beside me.

turns.speaker: BRIAN
turns.text: -- C'mon, Stephen.

turns.speaker: STEPHEN
turns.text: -- You split the team, man. And what was that crap with the standpipe? You'd think you and a hose were never introduced before.

turns.speaker: BRIAN
turns.text: Goddamn it Stephen!

turns.speaker: STEPHEN
turns.text: -- I told you to stay next to me!

turns.speaker: BRIAN
turns.text: -- I was doin' it! I was up there fucking doin' it. You don't know, man, you don't know what I did!

turns.speaker: STEPHEN
turns.text: What you did was drop the ball, Probie. Get that right.

turns.speaker: STEPHEN
turns.text: C'mon ladies, let's roll some hose...

turns.speaker: BRIAN
turns.text: -- Never mind.

turns.speaker: BRIAN
turns.text: Thanks.

turns.speaker: STEPHEN
turns.text: Brian --  -- See ya tonight.

turns.speaker: STEPHEN
turns.text: Hey.

turns.speaker: BRIAN
turns.text: Hey.

turns.speaker: BRIAN
turns.text: So you got a 'roid going with Jackson or what?

turns.speaker: STEPHEN
turns.text: Nah, he's nothin'. It's just sometimes... sometimes you just gotta punch somebody out, y'know?

turns.speaker: STEPHEN
turns.text: Look, Brian, a photographer. Maybe I can get on the cover of LIFE magazine, too.

turns.speaker: BRIAN
turns.text: C'mon, let's crawl home.
